Joï¿½o Miranda wrote:
> Hi,
> 
> I'm using Heritrix 1.12.1.
> 
> Under which conditions does the code "-4001 Too many link hops away from 
> seed" appear in logs? I intended to log the links not harvested because 
> of reaching the maximum set distance from seed.

Following nfoscarini's message, I went looking for places this status 
code would be set -- and couldn't find any. I believe it is left over 
from older versions of Heritrix and is no longer used.

To achieve your stated goal, I would look mostly at LinksScoper. It will 
log at 'INFO' level any scope-rejected URIs that are not also rejected 
by the optional set of additional DecideRules.

You can use Java properties to set the LinksScoper class logging level 
to INFO, and even to redirect its logging to a separate log file -- 
using standard Java logging control (nothing special to Heritrix).

With a typical scopes, many URIs would be rejected for reasons other 
than too-many-hops, and these would show up in the log as well. With 
some custom DecideRules, you could fix this.

Perhaps you would only log those which exceed your hops-count (creating 
a DecideRule in the LinksScoper 'rejectlog-decide-rules' that is the 
exact opposite of the one in your scope). This would still log some URIs 
that were REJECTed for other reasons (like off-focus or 
bad-URI-patterns) in addition to too-many hops.

To log exactly those that were REJECTed for too-many-hops, and nothing 
else, would require your scope rule to be a special version of 
too-many-hops, that marks up the CrawlURI when it is REJECTed. Then your 
later logging-limiting DecideRule could only log those so marked.

Hope this helps,

- Gordon @ IA
